meanings.definition: A world or reality that is opposite or contrary to the one we typically experience.
meanings.sent1: In the counterworld, everything is upside down and inside out.
meanings.sent2: The author created a counterworld where magic ruled over science.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a counterworld where cats walk humans on leashes is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were a counterworld where time flowed backwards.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a counterworld where the sky is green and the grass is blue.

meanings.definition: A fictional or imaginary world that serves as a contrast to the real world.
meanings.sent1: The counterworld in the story was a place of endless possibilities.
meanings.sent2: Children often escape to a counterworld of make-believe and wonder.
meanings.sent3: The counterworld in the movie was a whimsical land of talking animals.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a counterworld where dragons roamed freely.
meanings.sent5: Books can transport you to a counterworld where anything is possible.
